meanings.definition: To obtain or collect (something) with difficulty or effort, often by searching or asking for it.
meanings.sent1: She scrounged for spare change in the couch cushions.
meanings.sent2: He scrounged up enough courage to ask her out on a date.
meanings.sent3: The cat scrounged for treats in the pantry when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The detective scrounged for clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The explorer scrounged for food in the wilderness to survive.

meanings.definition: To gather or accumulate (something) by scavenging or begging.
meanings.sent1: The homeless man scrounged food from the trash cans behind the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The children scrounged together enough money to buy ice cream.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon scrounged through the campsite for leftovers.
meanings.sent4: The birds scrounged for nesting materials in the park.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel scrounged nuts for the winter in preparation.

meanings.definition: To obtain (something) by sponging or mooching off others.
meanings.sent1: He scrounged a ride to the concert from his friend.
meanings.sent2: She scrounged a free meal from her generous neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The cat scrounged a warm spot on the couch next to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The student scrounged notes from classmates before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The actor scrounged compliments from the audience after the performance.
